channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-5866] Hive divide operator generates wrong results in certain cases
item.description:
Current GenericUDFOPDivide seems having a bug. The following query generates NULL result.

hive> select 4BD / 25BD  from test limit 1;        
...
Total MapReduce CPU Time Spent: 890 msec
OK
NULL
Time taken: 7.901 seconds, Fetched: 1 row(s)

The correct result should be 0.16 in this query.
item.summary: Hive divide operator generates wrong results in certain cases

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12615390
What exactly was causing the null result in this case? I'll try to take a look at the patch in a bit.

Ok, I understand the issue now - the integer portion of the result type was (7,6) so only 1 integer digit, and trying to cast both operands to decimal(7,6) which would result in null for 24.
Changes look good, left a comment on RB.
Patch #3 modified the way that the result type of decimal division is computed. Two qfile tests were slightly changed.

Overall: +1 all checks pass
